meanings.sent1: After the breakup, they remained friends.
meanings.sent2: The breakup was hard, but they both moved on.
meanings.sent3: The breakup led to a lot of ice cream eating.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt like it shattered into pieces after the breakup.
meanings.sent5: The breakup left a scar on his heart that never fully healed.

meanings.definition: The act of breaking something into pieces.
meanings.sent1: The breakup of the glass made a loud noise.
meanings.sent2: Be careful with the breakup of the fragile vase.
meanings.sent3: The breakup of the cookie left crumbs everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The breakup of the mirror reflected a thousand shards.
meanings.sent5: The breakup of the piñata scattered candies all around.

meanings.sent1: The breakup of the land created two separate plots.
meanings.sent2: The breakup of the group led to new alliances.
meanings.sent3: The breakup of the traffic jam brought relief to drivers.
meanings.sent4: The breakup of the puzzle pieces made it easier to solve.
meanings.sent5: The breakup of the clouds allowed the sun to shine through.
